result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott T Hameister was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Early discharge at recommendation of agent if obligations fulfilled

miscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.
Good faith effort to seek/maintain employment

Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia  
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages   
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional 
No violent or abusive contact with family/no contact at the residence unless approved by the agent

Counseling/assessments deemed appropriate/follow through with current counseling/treatment
Take medications as prescribed
